histogram.name: GameMode.Result.{GameTypes}
histogram.summary: Records events of two types, when they occur. `Attempted` indicates the game mode of type {GameTypes} is entered. `Failed` indicates the previous attempt to enter game mode timed out or failed. They will only be recorded the first time we detect that game mode is entered/failed for each time that game mode is initially entered.

histogram.name: GameMode.TimeInGameMode.{GameTypes}
histogram.summary:
Time spent in a fullscreen {GameTypes} game. Recorded when leaving game mode (i.e. closing, un-fullscreening, or switching focus away from a game app which the user is immersed in.)
There are two purposes for this metric:
(primarily) For determining if there is a significant number of users spending little time in Game Mode. A significant number not in the top bucket would indicate we need hysteresis to avoid shutting down background tabs too early. This has a small granularity so we can determine the most effective cut-off point.
(secondarily) For grasping changes in engagement caused by Game Mode optimizations. Note that increasing engagement is not necessarily the main goal. It is to increase FPS and render quality, for which in ARC we have such metrics - see https://crbug.com/1358755
